rights.title: Your Data Protection Rights
rights.content: Under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), you have specific rights regarding your personal data. This statement explains how we collect, use, and protect your information when you contribute to Not a House, but a Home.

namedContributions.title: For Named Contributions:
items: Your name (for attribution purposes)
Your email address (for communication about your submission)
Design files and descriptions you submit
Technical data (IP address, browser type) for security purposes

anonymousContributions.title: For Anonymous Contributions:
items: Only the design files and descriptions you submit
No personal identifying information is collected or stored
Minimal technical data for security (automatically deleted after review)

legalBasis.title: Legal Basis for Processing
legalBasis.intro: We process your personal data based on:

items.title: Consent:
items.description: You provide explicit consent when submitting your contribution

items.title: Legitimate Interest:
items.description: Our humanitarian mission to help vulnerable communities

items.title: Public Interest:
items.description: Providing housing solutions serves the public good

dataUse.title: How We Use Your Data
items: Review and publish your design contributions
Provide attribution for your submissions
Communicate with you about your contribution (named submissions only)
Improve our platform and services
Ensure security and prevent misuse
Comply with legal obligations

designContent.title: Design Content:
designContent.intro: Your submitted designs may be shared globally as part of our humanitarian mission. This includes distribution to:
items: Individuals and communities in need of housing solutions
Non-profit organizations and aid agencies
Educational institutions for research and teaching
Government agencies working on housing issues

personalInfo.title: Personal Information:
personalInfo.content: Your personal contact information is never shared with third parties without your explicit consent, except as required by law.

gdprRights.title: Your GDPR Rights
gdprRights.intro: Under GDPR, you have the right to:

items.title: Access:
items.description: Request a copy of the personal data we hold about you

items.title: Rectification:
items.description: Correct any inaccurate or incomplete data

items.title: Erasure:
items.description: Request deletion of your personal data (with limitations for published content)

items.title: Restriction:
items.description: Limit how we process your data

items.title: Portability:
items.description: Receive your data in a structured, machine-readable format

items.title: Objection:
items.description: Object to processing based on legitimate interests

items.title: Withdraw Consent:
items.description: Withdraw your consent at any time

personalInfo.title: Personal Information:
items: Contact details: Retained for 3 years after last contact or until deletion requested
Submission metadata: Retained for administrative purposes

designContent.title: Design Content:
designContent.content: Published designs are retained indefinitely as part of our permanent humanitarian resource library. However, personal attribution can be removed upon request.

anonymous.title: Anonymous Submissions:
anonymous.content: No personal data is retained for anonymous submissions.

dataSecurity.title: Data Security
dataSecurity.intro: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data:
items: Encryption of data in transit and at rest
Regular security assessments and updates
Access controls and staff training
Secure backup and recovery procedures
Incident response protocols

internationalTransfers.title: International Transfers
internationalTransfers.intro: Given our global humanitarian mission, your data may be processed in countries outside the European Economic Area. We ensure appropriate safeguards are in place through:
items: Standard Contractual Clauses approved by the European Commission
Adequacy decisions for certain countries
Additional security measures where required

contact.title: Contact Information
contact.intro: For any questions about data protection or to exercise your GDPR rights, please contact:

details.title: Data Protection Officer
details.organization: Not a House, but a Home

supervisory.title: Supervisory Authority
supervisory.content: If you believe we have not handled your data properly, you have the right to lodge a complaint with your local data protection supervisory authority.

footer.acknowledgment: By submitting content and checking the GDPR acceptance box, you acknowledge that you have read and understood this data protection statement.
